results.adx_keywords: Musk, Elon;Tesla Motors Inc;Electric and Hybrid Vehicles;Automobiles;Boards of Directors;Twitter;Stocks and Bonds
results.byline: By DAVID GELLES, JAMES B. STEWART, JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and KATE KELLY
results.title: Elon Musk Details ‘Excruciating’ Personal Toll of Tesla Turmoil
results.abstract: After setting off a furor that unsettled the markets and his own board, the Tesla chief talks about the pressure he is under and his struggle to cope.

media.caption: Elon Musk, the chairman and chief executive of the electric-car maker Tesla. “This past year has been the most difficult and painful year of my career,” he said.

results.adx_keywords: Ronell, Avital;Reitman, Nimrod;Sexual Harassment;#MeToo Movement;New York University;Women's Rights;Women and Girls;Colleges and Universities;Title IX (Gender Discrimination Legislation);Butler, Judith;Suits and Litigation (Civil)
results.title: What Happens to #MeToo When a Feminist Is the Accused?
results.abstract: Avital Ronell, a superstar professor, was found by N.Y.U. to have sexually harassed a male grad student. But his charges have met disbelief from some feminist scholars.

media.caption: Nimrod Reitman accused his former N.Y.U. graduate school adviser, Avital Ronell, of sexually harassing him, and the university found her responsible. But some leading feminist scholars have supported her in ways that echo the defenses of male harassers.
media.copyright: Caitlin Ochs for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;Child Abuse and Neglect;Priests;Roman Catholic Church;Pennsylvania;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Statutes of Limitations
results.byline: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and SHARON OTTERMAN
results.title: Catholic Priests Abused 1,000 Children in Pennsylvania, Report Says
results.abstract: The grand jury report is the government’s broadest look yet in the United States at child sexual abuse in the church.

media.caption: Victims of clerical sex abuse and their relatives reacted as Attorney General Josh Shapiro discussed the grand jury report at a news conference in Harrisburg.

results.title: White House Counsel, Don McGahn, Has Cooperated Extensively in Mueller Inquiry
results.abstract: The White House counsel, Donald F. McGahn II, was a witness to key episodes being scrutinized in the case. His cooperation with investigators is unusual.
des_facet: RUSSIAN INTERFERENCE IN 2016 US ELECTIONS AND TIES TO TRUMP ASSOCIATES

media.caption: Mr. McGahn’s relationship with the president soured as Mr. Trump blamed him for a number of fraught moments in his first months in office, including the existence of the special counsel’s inquiry.

results.adx_keywords: Franklin, Aretha;Deaths (Obituaries);Gospel Music;Pop and Rock Music;Rhythm and Blues
results.title: Aretha Franklin, Indomitable ‘Queen of Soul,’ Dies at 76
results.abstract: With hits like “Respect” and “Chain of Fools,” she defined a female archetype: sensual and strong, long-suffering but ultimately indomitable.

media.caption: Ms. Franklin backstage at the Apollo in 1971.

results.adx_keywords: Freedom of the Press;News and News Media;Trump, Donald J;United States Politics and Government
results.title: A Free Press Needs You
results.abstract: Don’t just take it from us. Scores of publications from around the country are raising their voices.

results.title: Fentanyl Used to Execute Nebraska Inmate, in a First for U.S.
results.abstract: Nebraska has used fentanyl in its first execution since 1997, becoming the first state to kill a prisoner with the help of the powerful opioid.

media.caption: The Nebraska State Penitentiary in Lincoln, Neb., where Carey Dean Moore was executed on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Luke Franke for The New York Times

results.title: The Flourishing Business of Fake YouTube Views
results.abstract: Plays can be bought for pennies and delivered in bulk, inflating videos’ popularity and making the social media giant vulnerable to manipulation.
org_facet: RUSSIAN INTERFERENCE IN 2016 US ELECTIONS AND TIES TO TRUMP ASSOCIATES

results.adx_keywords: Avenatti, Michael;Obama, Michelle;Trump, Donald J;Democratic Party;Iowa;Presidential Election of 2020;Presidential Election of 2016
results.title: Michael Avenatti Urges Democrats to Reject Michelle Obama’s Advice on Trump
results.abstract: Mrs. Obama said, “When they go low, we go high.” In his first speech as a prospective presidential candidate, Mr. Avenatti told Democrats to “fight fire with fire” instead.

media.caption: Michael Avenatti gave his first speech as a prospective presidential candidate on Friday at the Wing Ding, a Democratic Party fund-raiser in Clear Lake, Iowa.

results.adx_keywords: Medical Schools;New York University School of Medicine;Tuition;Scholarships and Fellowships;Assn of American Medical Colleges;Langone, Kenneth G;Langone, Elaine;New York City
results.title: Surprise Gift: Free Tuition for All N.Y.U. Medical Students
results.abstract: A plan will cover the $55,000 annual tuition for every current and future New York University School of Medicine student, regardless of financial need.
org_facet: NEW YORK UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MEDICINE

media.caption: New York University’s School of Medicine announced on Thursday that it would cover tuition for all its current and future students. “This decision recognizes a moral imperative that must be addressed, as institutions place an increasing debt burden on young people who aspire to become physicians,” the dean of the school said.
media.copyright: Michael Kirby Smith for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Airlines and Airplanes;Alaska Airlines;Airport Security;Horizon Air;Seattle-Tacoma International Airport;Russell, Richard B (d 2018)
results.byline: By JACEY FORTIN and SARAH MERVOSH
results.title: Stolen Plane Crashes After Airline Employee Takes Off From Seattle Airport
results.abstract: Seattle-Tacoma International Airport said no passengers were on the 76-seat plane, which officials said was taken by an airline employee believed to be suicidal.

media.caption: The stolen Q400 Horizon Air plane was seen on videos diving, looping and rolling over Puget Sound at sunset before it crashed on Ketron Island.

results.title: F.B.I. Agent Peter Strzok, Who Criticized Trump in Texts, Is Fired
results.abstract: Mr. Strzok was one of the F.B.I.’s top counterintelligence officials. But his disparaging texts about President Trump handed a weapon to conservatives assailing the Russia investigation.
des_facet: RUSSIAN INTERFERENCE IN 2016 US ELECTIONS AND TIES TO TRUMP ASSOCIATES

media.caption: Peter Strzok, a top F.B.I. counterintelligence agent who was taken off the special counsel investigation after his disparaging texts about President Trump were uncovered, was fired.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.title: Richard Russell, Who Stole Plane Near Seattle, Raises Troubling Security Questions
results.abstract: Richard B. Russell, a ground service agent at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, flew a turboprop aircraft for nearly an hour over Puget Sound.

media.caption: Richard B. Russell, a ground service agent at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport. Mr. Russell stole a plane from the airport and flew it for about an hour before it crashed.

results.title: Omarosa Manigault Newman Taped Her Firing by John Kelly
results.abstract: The recording, played on “Meet the Press,” revealed the White House chief of staff suggesting that Ms. Manigault Newman could face damage to her reputation if she did not leave quietly.

media.caption: Omarosa Manigault Newman said that she had recorded conversations because “this is a White House where everybody lies.”

results.adx_keywords: Moriarty, Paddy (d 2017);Larrimah (Australia);Missing Persons;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Australia
results.title: In a Town of 11 People, Mysterious Disappearance Turns Neighbor Against Neighbor
results.abstract: Rumors abound in a small town in the Australian outback. Was Paddy Moriarty fed to a pet crocodile? Or could he have been baked into a meat pie?

media.caption: Eight months after he disappeared, a missing person sign remains outside the Larrimah, Australia, home of Paddy Moriarty.
media.copyright: Adam Ferguson for The New York Times
